meanings.sent1: After the experiment, the scientist observed the reoxidations of the metal.
meanings.sent2: The reoxidations of the iron caused it to rust even more.
meanings.sent3: The reoxidations of the apple turned it into a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the reoxidations of a fire, never giving up.
meanings.sent5: The reoxidations of the paint made it peel off in layers.

meanings.definition: The process of adding oxygen back to a substance.
meanings.sent1: In the lab, they studied the reoxidations of the chemicals to understand the reaction.
meanings.sent2: The reoxidations of the fire helped it burn brighter.
meanings.sent3: The reoxidations of the balloon made it float even higher.
meanings.sent4: Her love was like the reoxidations of air, always refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The reoxidations of the plant's leaves made them greener.

meanings.definition: The repeated oxidation of a compound.
meanings.sent1: The reoxidations of the metal caused it to weaken over time.
meanings.sent2: The reoxidations of the fuel made the engine run smoother.
meanings.sent3: The reoxidations of the cookie dough made it rise multiple times.
meanings.sent4: His anger was like the reoxidations of a storm, building up slowly.
meanings.sent5: The reoxidations of the water turned it into a powerful cleaning agent.
